publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2905# Susan Deacon: Postnatal Depression—That the Parliament recognises the prevalence of postnatal depression amongst women in Scotland, affecting at least 12,000 women each year; congratulates all who work to raise awareness of the impact that postnatal depression can have on women and their families; understands that dedicated support and resources are often needed, and welcomes the initiative taken by the Church of Scotland’s Postnatal Depression Project in launching a national awareness day, Bluebell Day, on 6 June 2005. Supported by: Mr David Davidson*, Christine May*, Brian Adam*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Rob Gibson*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Sarah Boyack*, Jackie Baillie*, Bruce Crawford*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Michael McMahon*, Campbell Martin*, Murray Tosh*, Richard Lochhead*, Robin Harper*, Eleanor Scott*, Christine Grahame*

S2M-2905 # Susan Deacon: Postnatal Depression—That the Parliament recognises the prevalence of postnatal depression amongst women in Scotland, affecting at least 12,000 women each year; congratulates all who work to raise awareness of the impact that postnatal depression can have on women and their families; understands that dedicated support and resources are often needed, and welcomes the initiative taken by the Church of Scotland’s Postnatal Depression Project in launching a national awareness day, Bluebell Day, on 6 June 2005. Supported by: Mr David Davidson, Christine May, Brian Adam, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Rob Gibson, Mr Alasdair Morrison, Sarah Boyack, Jackie Baillie, Bruce Crawford, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Michael McMahon, Campbell Martin, Murray Tosh, Richard Lochhead, Robin Harper, Eleanor Scott, Christine Grahame, Carolyn Leckie*, Chris Ballance*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Bill Butler*, Cathie Craigie*, Tricia Marwick*, Nora Radcliffe*, Fiona Hyslop*, Patrick Harvie*, Shiona Baird*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Marlyn Glen*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Shona Robison*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr Frank McAveety*
